quest.name: Konogg, Alone
journal: The dig site chief is still concerned about the twins.

The chief tells you that naught has changed since last you spoke─Anogg's whereabouts remain unknown, and Konogg has yet to emerge from the doldrums or his place in the tunnels. Though there is little to be done about the former, perhaps a friendly word with Konogg might cheer the young dwarf.
You seek out Konogg, but find him stricken with a fever. Though you insist that he rest, it is not altogether clear that he is lucid enough to understand. Perhaps the chief will be able to help.
The chief seems distraught to hear that Konogg is unwell. He resolves to fetch a remedy posthaste, barking hasty orders to meet him at Konogg's bedside before rushing off.
You return to where you left Konogg, along with the worried chief. Unfortunately, the young dwarf is no longer abed, nor indeed anywhere in sight.

Upon consulting with the chief about this dismaying development, the two of you resolve to speak with the villagers. If Konogg has indeed wandered off in his half-conscious state, someone likely took notice.
Though you ask a variety of potential witnesses, not a single dwarf produces information that might lead you to Konogg. Perhaps the chief has had better luck.

The chief tells you that one of his miners indeed caught sight of a feverish Konogg making his way from the village. He was headed in the direction of the crater whence you previously entered the Puppets' Bunker─so that is again where you must go if you would bring him home.
You gaze out over the crater, but Konogg is nowhere to be found amongst the bulky metal debris. For better or worse, you have an inkling as to where he has gone...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Lali-I may have been too optimistic-ho, Forename.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: The fact that the villagers are still nursing a grudge doesn't surprise me─not that I haven't tried to make them think better of it. But why hasn't Anogg come back and given them what for yet? It ain't like her to fret over what people think.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Then there's Konogg. I was worried he'd go chasing after her again─which is why I'm even more worried that he's been shut up in the tunnels this whole time.

dialogue.name: STRONGMINER00642
dialogue.text: We need to clear the rubble so we can start digging again, but the others won't stop bickering about whose job it is. Not even when I threaten to boot 'em clear into the sea!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'll be right there. Two boots are better'n one, as they say.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Looks like I have other business to take care of─not that I was having much luck here. Can you check on Konogg in my stead?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: What with Anogg gone and the villagers treating him like he's got the blight, he could do with a reminder that not everyone has abandoned him...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: And who's to say─maybe one of your tales of adventure will cheer him up.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've got just the thing! Though I've forgotten the names of everyone involved.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Or scar him for life...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'm sure whatever you come up with will be fine. Probably.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: ...And let me know how he's doing, all right? Even if he doesn't want to talk to me, I─ I want him to have the help he needs, is all.

dialogue.name: POD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Konogg is radiating an uncommon amount of heat. The many layers insulating his head probably aren't helping.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Wh-What...?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You collapsed, is what. You need rest...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: That feeling like your head is full of fiery bees? That's a fever.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: No, I'm...fine... Got to...find Anogg...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nope. You're not going anywhere.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Anogg wouldn't want you running after her in this state.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg... Anogg, I'm...

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Anogg...

dialogue.name: POD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Konogg collapsed!?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We need to do something about that fever! I think some of my wife's supply of remedies survived...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I'll go and see─you keep an eye on Konogg!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I thought you said he was bedridden!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Wicked white, where did he go?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I know he wanted to search for Anogg, but how did he even make it out of here?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Willpower and hubris?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: We'll worry about that later.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Damn it all─let's go. Quickly!

dialogue.name: 2B
dialogue.text: Who's there?

dialogue.name: 2B
dialogue.text: You...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: We should ask around, find out if anyone saw him go past.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Not that I expect they'll be too inclined to help...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Still, any lead is better than none at all. I'll speak with my miners, you talk to...whoever else.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: No, I haven't seen Konogg leaving the village... Why?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954
dialogue.text: Finally realized he's no good to us and left, did he?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: But without him or Anogg, who's going to be held responsible for what happened?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB03954
dialogue.text: Their collaborator here, for one. Listen, outsider, I'm sure you thought you were helping, but...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERD03954
dialogue.text: Now we're doooooomed!

dialogue.name: GESUGG
dialogue.text: A search for Konogg, you say? That can't be easy. Those twins aren't really the sort to stand still.

dialogue.name: GESUGG
dialogue.text: Wish I could help, but I haven't seen anything out of the ordinary─not more than usual, at any rate. Certainly no fever-addled dwarves.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: Now Konogg's missin' too? We're droppin' dwarves like ale from a leaky cask!

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: Well, I hope you find 'em. The matter of culpability is still unsettled, and I'll never get the villagers to agree on what's what if the most guilty-lookin' parties up and vanish...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERE03954
dialogue.text: Now, more than ever, it's important that we exercise prudence─just as I'm always urging.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERC03954

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA03954
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: GESUGG
dialogue.text: I've run out of machine oil... Other than that, no, I still have nothing to tell you.

dialogue.name: GLAGG
dialogue.text: I almost wish a few of those damned Tholls would turn up. Nothing brings us all together like a spot of unfriendly rivalry.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Lali-I thought I'd never escape-ho! Who knew that questioning every miner in Komra could be so time-consuming...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I hope you weren't waiting too long. Did you learn anything useful?

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Wish I could say I was surprised.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: My lot also had some...difficulty focusing on the immediate issue, but one of them did see Konogg.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: It sounds like he was wandering in the direction of the crater─again. We should search the area.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: What's that big wheel? Some kind of machine?

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: An enemy stronghold.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Technology from another world...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Well, that doesn't sound good. Though I'm still more concerned about where Konogg might have gone.

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: I have a bad─and familiar!─feeling about this...

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Perhaps I should have mentioned where exactly I found him last time.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: You think he's inside? And he's probably not alone...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: <sigh> Here we go again.
